In a recent article written for The New Statesman, Tony Blair argued that the Labour Party must not "settle back into its old territory of defending the status quo" and remain "as the party opposing 'Tory cuts'

Marriage tax breaks should go ahead

David Cameron has assured supporters that proposals for a stay-at-home member of a married couple/civil partnership to be able to transfer PS750 of their tax-free personal allowance to their working spouse will indeed be fulfilled

Political Socs react to referenda

Campaigning and voting for YUSU's twice-yearly referenda has begun on campus with four proposed motions brought forward for discussion. Following a debate and AGM last Wednesday, voting opened for all students on Thursday with discussion and publicity now flooding social media

Students with lower grades 'set up to fail' by universities

Universities have started to accept students with much lower entry grades than required in order to fill course spaces in whatever way they can. This has sparked new fears that less able students will fall behind at degree level
